required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combivir And Maraviroc In Antiretroviral Naive Subjects In Russia
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Label Study Of Maraviroc, Zidovudine And Lamivudine Twice Daily For The Treatment Of Antiretroviral Naïve HIV-Infected Patients With R5 HIV-1 In Russia

brief_summary.textblock: One hundred subjects in Russia will be treated with a combination of Combivir (zidovudine and lamivudine) and maraviroc as their first line HIV therapy. The aim is to assess the efficacy and safety of this combination in a Russian population of patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Plasma Human Immuno Deficiency Virus-1 Ribonucleic Acid (HIV-1 RNA) Load <50 Copies/Milliliter (mL) at 48 Weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Participants' responder status at Week 48 was assessed according to Missing, discontinuation= Failure (MDF) algorithm. This algorithm treats all participants with HIV 1 RNA data missing at the time of interest or discontinuation of study drug as failures or non responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Virologic Response: Percentage of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA Load <50 Copies/mL at Post-baseline Visits.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 20, Week 24, Week 36 and Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Participants' responder status at Week 48 was assessed according to MDF algorithm. This algorithm treats all participants with HIV 1 RNA data missing at the time of interest or discontinuation of study drug as failures or non responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Virologic Response: Percentage of Participants With Plasma HIV-1 RNA Load < 400 Copies/mL at Post-baseline Visits.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 20, Week 24, Week 36 and Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Participants' responder status at Week 48 was assessed according to MDF algorithm. This algorithm treats all participants with HIV 1 RNA data missing at the time of interest or discontinuation of study drug as failures or non responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Virologic Response: Rate of Virologic Failure at Week 48.
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic failure defined as: failure to achieve a reduction from baseline in HIV 1 RNA ≥ 0.5 log10 copies /mL by the second viral load determination (unless viral load was below the lower limit level of quantification [LLOQ]); or a ≥ 0.5 log10 increase from nadir in HIV 1 RNA after achieving a HIV 1 RNA reduction from BL >0.5 log10 copies/mL; or a HIV 1 RNA level of >1000 copies/mL after having achieved a HIV 1 RNA level below LLOQ. Participants with Time to loss of virologic response (defined by level of <50 copies/mL) failure were classified as rebounders or non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunological Response at Week 48: Absolute Change From Baseline in Absolute Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunological Response was summarized using absolute change from Baseline to Week 48 in absolute CD4+ cell count

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunological Response at Week 48: Percentage Change From Baseline in Absolute Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunological Response was summarized using percentage change from Baseline to Week 48 in absolute CD4+ cell count

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunological Response at Week 48: Absolute Change From Baseline in Absolute Cluster of Differentiation 8 (CD8)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunological Response was summarized using absolute change from Baseline to Week 48 in absolute CD8+ cell count.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunological Response at Week 48: Percentage Change From Baseline in Absolute Cluster of Differentiation 8 (CD8)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunological Response was summarized using percentage change from Baseline to Week 48 in absolute CD8+ cell count.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunological Response at Week 48: Change From Baseline in Absolute Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4)/ Cluster of Differentiation 8 (CD8) Ratio.
secondary_outcome.description: Immunological Response was summarized using absolute change from Baseline to Week 48 in absolute CD4+/ CD8+ ratio.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Genotypic Resistance.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening to Week 48 or Time of treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: The viral genotypes were captured at Baseline and at treatment failure or Early termination and any resistance-associated mutations summarized descriptively at Week 48 for the Nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs), and non-NRTIs (NNRTIs)drug classes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HIV-1 RNA Tropism Status Using Genotyping Assay at Screening and at the Time of Virologic Failure.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening to Week 48 or Time of treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in tropism were summarized at the time of treatment failure or Early Termination (note: this was performed for participants with viral load > 400 copies/mL only).

arm_group.description: Single arm study of combivir and maraviroc for 48 weeks

intervention.description: Combivir one tablet BD with maraviroc 300mg BD for 48 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over 18 years of age.
- R5 HIV infection on screening tropism test.
- Viral load >1,000 copies/mL.
- Never previously treated with anti-HIV medicines.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously treated with anti-HIV medicines.
- Hepatitis B co-infection.

facility.name: Regional Center on AIDS and Infectious Diseases Prophylaxis and Control
Federal scientific and methodological center on AIDS prophylaxis and control
Moscow regional center on AIDS and infectious diseases prophylaxis and control
Regional Center on AIDS and Infectious Diseases Prophylaxis and Control
Saint-Petersburg Center on AIDS and Infectious Diseases Prophylaxis and Control
Federal State Institution Republican clinical infectious hospital of Roszdrav
Smolensk Center on AIDS and infectious diseases prophylaxis and control
Volgograd Regional Center on AIDS and Infectious Diseases Prophylaxis and Control

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This report presents results of a 48 week study conducted at 8 centers in Russia. A total of 98 subjects were enrolled in the study; however, one site was closed and data from this site was deemed unusable, thus in total 77 subjects were included in the analysis.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Treatment naïve Human Immuno Deficiency Virus (HIV) infected participants aged 18 years at screening were enrolled. Participants were required to meet all eligibility criteria prior to randomization into the study.

group.title: Maraviroc+Combivir
group.description: All participants received Maraviroc (300 milligram [mg] twice daily) in combination with Combivir (fixed dose combination of zidovudine 300 mg and lamivudine 150 mg)

outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population included those participants who had taken at least 1 dose of the study drug.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Genotypic Resistance.
outcome.description: The viral genotypes were captured at Baseline and at treatment failure or Early termination and any resistance-associated mutations summarized descriptively at Week 48 for the Nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs), and non-NRTIs (NNRTIs)drug classes.
outcome.time_frame: Screening to Week 48 or Time of treatment Failure
outcome.population: All participants who discontinued therapy early or who reached Week 48 with sufficient plasma HIV 1 RNA for analysis (500 copies/mL) were included in the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline to follow-up period (28 days after the last dose of study)
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Maraviroc+Combivir
group.description: All participants received Maraviroc (300 milligram [mg] twice daily) in combination with Combivir (fixed dose combination of zidovudine 300 mg and lamivudine 150 mg)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
